SUMMARY: transcriptional repressor DeoR, for Deoxyribose Regulator, is involved in negative expression of genes related to transport and catabolism of deoxyribonucleoside nucleotides [171553, 6098525, 2998936, 3019678, 2826388, 3019678, 2265760, 2667765, 1791752, 2115441]. DeoR belongs to DeoR family of transcriptional regulators [2994018, 8955387]. This protein consists of two domains, an amino-terminal domain that contains a potential helix-turn-helix DNA-binding motif and a carboxy-terminal domain involved in oligomerization and recognition of a possible co-inducer [2994018, 8955387, 18844374]. DeoR is an octamer in solution [2653814] and it forms multiple complexes (oligomers) in its target promoters; cooperative binding of this regulator to different tandem inverted repeat sequences generates a repression DNA loop [8001800, 1809188, 2667765, 3019678, 3004952, 16453417, 2653814, 1437558]. binding targets for DeoR consist of 16-nucleotide inverted repeat sequences that possess conserved motifs [8455551, 3019678, 1437558].
